page.title: 14NORTHCROFT RECREATION CENTRE
page.content: This building was built in 1980 and opened by olympic gold medalist, David Wilkie on 13th september. The staff consists of 4 managers, 7 lifeguards, 5 receptionists, 2 cleaners and 10 partime lifeguards. The activities at the moment are swimming, squash, table tennis, multi-gym, gymnastics, yoga, fencing and self defence. On the side there is being built an extension which will house a bar, separate changing rooms for dry sports and swimming and a new multi-gym. At the moment the average number of people using the swimming pools on a busy day is about 2,000. The centre is only closed 3 times a year at Christmas, Boxing Day and New Year's Day. Since the centre was built thousands of people have used it and in all the recreation centre has been a great asset to the people of Newbury.
